alternatives.transcript: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin, and I'm cooking at home. When I make black bean soup, I make a lot of it. I have 1 pound of black bean here, because I make it and then I freeze it in container. It takes a while to cook. I used to have a restaurant on Fifth Avenue in New York called La Potagerie. I used to do, that was 1 of the soap who was pictured there. Part of my wife's background, Cuban and Puerto Rican. What you do, I've done it already, you know, go through the bean this way to make sure that there is no stone. I have done it here. I have another 1. And another 1 here, or a damaged bin. And then what I do After that, I rinse them out. I rinse this out under water. And now I have my small bins. 2 quart of water. I may add more water later on. 1 quart of chicken stock. Half a cup of rice. Sometimes I use brown rice. Half a teaspoon of cumin and of chili powder. And that of course you can always change that you like it, you don't like it. You want another seasoning, it's fine. This is all a question of taste. And 1 teaspoon of salt. I probably would have more salt later on. So that's it. As soon as it come to a good boil, Cover it, very low heat, an hour and a half, 2 hours. Well, let's just check the black bean soup. And frankly, The beans are practically cooked. So as you see, an hour and a half there. I have that big bunch of cilantro here. All I usually do, take the top off. I keep that as a garnish. This very often I take it and I freeze it, you know, And I use it frozen, but in that case, it's fresh. That's going to go in the soup now. Sometimes I put tomato, and you can put tomato. It's perfectly fine, a can of tomato. Here I have a jar or a can or whatever of hot salsa. Medium. So you can have it. Sometimes it's very hot. Sometimes it's medium hot. And all that will work. I have like 5, 6 clove of garlic here. I have a leek. Maybe a little too much, but I say we'll have 3 cup here. About 3 cup of leek, couple of cup of onion. And this, We'll have to cook for another hour. I may add a little more liquid or not, depending how thick it is, but certainly, I need salt, half a teaspoon. Bring that to a boil again. Slow it, cook for an hour. Okay, now the black bean soup is finally cooked, and I think that it's too thick. I'm going to put another couple of, cup, cup and a half, depending the way you like it, of the chicken stock or water. It'd be perfectly fine, too. I have enough soup here for like 12 people. And usually what I do, I take a couple of tablespoon of this, a couple of cup of this in the food processor or blender and put it back in there to kind of make it creamier and all that. Of course, if you have that type of machine, I can do that in there. You know, just. Yeah, that's about it. Just to give a certain creaminess to it. And as I said, I do that in container and I freeze it. You know, that's the best way to do it. But I want to show you a couple of ways that I serve it at my house. You can see it's quite thick. I'm gonna do cilantro into it. 1 way my wife loves it, it's with a banana. I guess in the style of Cuba, I guess. Now, If you do banana head, you can slice your banana head. Make sure you put that with a little tablespoon of lemon juice or something like that so that, so here, add some banana. 1 for me. Well, I could put a little bit of onion. Those are Vidalia type of onion, very mild. But even though when I do a lot of onion, I had like this, I rinse it under water. So it prevented from discoloring and it will stay white now. This 1 here, a garnish of eggs is good too. I cut the eggs 1 way, then you go back the other way. And that makes a perfect egg salad, you know, when you cut it both ways, this way. So I will have the garnish of eggs. In my restaurant in New York at La Potagerie, I think we serve it with a garnish of eggs. Always, I serve it probably with a few drop of Tabasco on top, or you can let your guests do it. And even sometime, a dash of a bit of olive oil on top like this to give a glaze, you know, and sometimes even a dash of vinegar. Sometimes people like a bit of acidity there. Oh, this 1 I'll leave this way. And there is for my wife, my homemade black bean soup with 2 interpretation of it. I hope you

paragraphs.transcript:
Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin, and I'm cooking at home. When I make black bean soup, I make a lot of it. I have 1 pound of black bean here, because I make it and then I freeze it in container. It takes a while to cook. I used to have a restaurant on Fifth Avenue in New York called La Potagerie.

I used to do, that was 1 of the soap who was pictured there. Part of my wife's background, Cuban and Puerto Rican. What you do, I've done it already, you know, go through the bean this way to make sure that there is no stone. I have done it here. I have another 1.

And another 1 here, or a damaged bin. And then what I do After that, I rinse them out. I rinse this out under water. And now I have my small bins. 2 quart of water.

I may add more water later on. 1 quart of chicken stock. Half a cup of rice. Sometimes I use brown rice. Half a teaspoon of cumin and of chili powder.

And that of course you can always change that you like it, you don't like it. You want another seasoning, it's fine. This is all a question of taste. And 1 teaspoon of salt. I probably would have more salt later on.

So that's it. As soon as it come to a good boil, Cover it, very low heat, an hour and a half, 2 hours. Well, let's just check the black bean soup. And frankly, The beans are practically cooked. So as you see, an hour and a half there.

I have that big bunch of cilantro here. All I usually do, take the top off. I keep that as a garnish. This very often I take it and I freeze it, you know, And I use it frozen, but in that case, it's fresh. That's going to go in the soup now.

Sometimes I put tomato, and you can put tomato. It's perfectly fine, a can of tomato. Here I have a jar or a can or whatever of hot salsa. Medium. So you can have it.

Sometimes it's very hot. Sometimes it's medium hot. And all that will work. I have like 5, 6 clove of garlic here. I have a leek.

Maybe a little too much, but I say we'll have 3 cup here. About 3 cup of leek, couple of cup of onion. And this, We'll have to cook for another hour. I may add a little more liquid or not, depending how thick it is, but certainly, I need salt, half a teaspoon. Bring that to a boil again.

Slow it, cook for an hour. Okay, now the black bean soup is finally cooked, and I think that it's too thick. I'm going to put another couple of, cup, cup and a half, depending the way you like it, of the chicken stock or water. It'd be perfectly fine, too. I have enough soup here for like 12 people.

And usually what I do, I take a couple of tablespoon of this, a couple of cup of this in the food processor or blender and put it back in there to kind of make it creamier and all that. Of course, if you have that type of machine, I can do that in there. You know, just. Yeah, that's about it. Just to give a certain creaminess to it.

And as I said, I do that in container and I freeze it. You know, that's the best way to do it. But I want to show you a couple of ways that I serve it at my house. You can see it's quite thick. I'm gonna do cilantro into it.

1 way my wife loves it, it's with a banana. I guess in the style of Cuba, I guess. Now, If you do banana head, you can slice your banana head. Make sure you put that with a little tablespoon of lemon juice or something like that so that, so here, add some banana. 1 for me.

Well, I could put a little bit of onion. Those are Vidalia type of onion, very mild. But even though when I do a lot of onion, I had like this, I rinse it under water. So it prevented from discoloring and it will stay white now. This 1 here, a garnish of eggs is good too.

I cut the eggs 1 way, then you go back the other way. And that makes a perfect egg salad, you know, when you cut it both ways, this way. So I will have the garnish of eggs. In my restaurant in New York at La Potagerie, I think we serve it with a garnish of eggs. Always, I serve it probably with a few drop of Tabasco on top, or you can let your guests do it.

And even sometime, a dash of a bit of olive oil on top like this to give a glaze, you know, and sometimes even a dash of vinegar. Sometimes people like a bit of acidity there. sentences.text: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin, and I'm cooking at home.
When I make black bean soup, I make a lot of it.
I have 1 pound of black bean here, because I make it and then I freeze it in container.
It takes a while to cook.
I used to have a restaurant on Fifth Avenue in New York called La Potagerie.
I used to do, that was 1 of the soap who was pictured there.
Part of my wife's background, Cuban and Puerto Rican.
What you do, I've done it already, you know, go through the bean this way to make sure that there is no stone.
I have done it here.
I have another 1.
And another 1 here, or a damaged bin.
And then what I do After that, I rinse them out.
I rinse this out under water.
And now I have my small bins.
2 quart of water.
I may add more water later on.
1 quart of chicken stock.
Half a cup of rice.
Sometimes I use brown rice.
Half a teaspoon of cumin and of chili powder.
And that of course you can always change that you like it, you don't like it.
You want another seasoning, it's fine.
This is all a question of taste.
And 1 teaspoon of salt.
I probably would have more salt later on.
So that's it.
As soon as it come to a good boil, Cover it, very low heat, an hour and a half, 2 hours.
Well, let's just check the black bean soup.
And frankly, The beans are practically cooked.
So as you see, an hour and a half there.
I have that big bunch of cilantro here.
All I usually do, take the top off.
I keep that as a garnish.
This very often I take it and I freeze it, you know, And I use it frozen, but in that case, it's fresh.
That's going to go in the soup now.
Sometimes I put tomato, and you can put tomato.
It's perfectly fine, a can of tomato.
Here I have a jar or a can or whatever of hot salsa.
Medium.
So you can have it.
Sometimes it's very hot.
Sometimes it's medium hot.
And all that will work.
I have like 5, 6 clove of garlic here.
I have a leek.
Maybe a little too much, but I say we'll have 3 cup here.
About 3 cup of leek, couple of cup of onion.
And this, We'll have to cook for another hour.
I may add a little more liquid or not, depending how thick it is, but certainly, I need salt, half a teaspoon.
Bring that to a boil again.
Slow it, cook for an hour.
Okay, now the black bean soup is finally cooked, and I think that it's too thick.
I'm going to put another couple of, cup, cup and a half, depending the way you like it, of the chicken stock or water.
It'd be perfectly fine, too.
I have enough soup here for like 12 people.
And usually what I do, I take a couple of tablespoon of this, a couple of cup of this in the food processor or blender and put it back in there to kind of make it creamier and all that.
Of course, if you have that type of machine, I can do that in there.
You know, just.
Yeah, that's about it.
Just to give a certain creaminess to it.
And as I said, I do that in container and I freeze it.
You know, that's the best way to do it.
But I want to show you a couple of ways that I serve it at my house.
You can see it's quite thick.
I'm gonna do cilantro into it.
1 way my wife loves it, it's with a banana.
I guess in the style of Cuba, I guess.
Now, If you do banana head, you can slice your banana head.
Make sure you put that with a little tablespoon of lemon juice or something like that so that, so here, add some banana.
1 for me.
Well, I could put a little bit of onion.
Those are Vidalia type of onion, very mild.
But even though when I do a lot of onion, I had like this, I rinse it under water.
So it prevented from discoloring and it will stay white now.
This 1 here, a garnish of eggs is good too.
I cut the eggs 1 way, then you go back the other way.
And that makes a perfect egg salad, you know, when you cut it both ways, this way.
So I will have the garnish of eggs.
In my restaurant in New York at La Potagerie, I think we serve it with a garnish of eggs.
Always, I serve it probably with a few drop of Tabasco on top, or you can let your guests do it.
And even sometime, a dash of a bit of olive oil on top like this to give a glaze, you know, and sometimes even a dash of vinegar.
Sometimes people like a bit of acidity there.
Oh, this 1 I'll leave this way.
And there is for my wife, my homemade black bean soup with 2 interpretation of it.
I hope you
